title: Looking for a compliment
content:
Looking for a compliment to Luxury Platinum, Any thoughts?

[http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=536&subpage=viewfonts...](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906231549/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=536&subpage=viewfontspecimens "http://www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=536&subpage=viewfontspecimens")

 [‹ is there a typeface that depicts lights as in the lights seen in Las Vagas etc.](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906231549/http:/typophile.com/node/30009 "Go to previous forum topic") [Understanding cyrillic letters? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906231549/http:/typophile.com/node/30024 "Go to next forum topic")
author: JB01

comments.content:
Compliment (with an i) means praise.... I read the title and thought you wanted us to compliment you.

Complement (with an e) is something which completes.

K.
What is the intended use? How will it be reproduced? Who will see/read the design work? Details, details . . .

Surely Luxury was designed to complement itself?

Tim

Luxury Text?

Or complement LP in which direction?  
Do you have an early layout to show?
Luxury Text and you look young. There. A complement and a compliment.
What are you creating? Will it be used for text or display?

ummm... You are a nice person.

Are you looking for a sans or another serif?

Mikey

Thanks for all the “compliments”!

I’m looking for a sans “complement” to Luxury Platinum. I’m considering the luxury font for a wordmark and the yet unidentified sans for secondary information.

Many Thanks

You probably have reason not to use Luxury Gold.

Anyway, you could see if you like Trade Gothic or Engraver’s Gothic.
